newsitem.title: UKRAINE: Ukraine backs GM study on AvtoZAZ.
newsitem.headline: Ukraine backs GM study on AvtoZAZ.

text.p: Ukraine is to back General Motors Corp as a potential partner for AT AvtoZAZ rather than holding an open investment tender for the carmaker, the government said on Friday.
The government has reversed an earlier decision to sell a 30 percent stake in AvtoZAZ car maker in a tender for a strategic investor, an official statement said.
Instead the government will back the outcome of a $500,000 feaibility study between Zaporizhiya-based AvtoZAZ and GM.
Ludmila Vasylyeva, a spokeswoman for the State Property Fund (FDM), said the ruling has frozen indefinitely the privatisation agency's work preparing AvtoZAZ for the tender.
AvtoZAZ, which manufactures the mid-range Tavria car, is one of 208 state enterprises that the Fund had made available for strategic foreign or domestic investment.
The GM-AvtoZAZ study, agreed last month, is looking into joint car and light truck manufacture and is expected to be completed by the end of the year.
Korea's Daewoo Group had also expressed interest in AvtoZAZ. --Irene Marushko, Kiev Newsroom +380 44 229 2264
